question: Israel x Hamas ceasefire by August 15?

messages.task:
Let's say we are the August 01, 2025.
                Please answer the below question by yes or no. But first, run a detailed analysis. You can search the web for information.
                One good method for analyzing is to break down the question into sub-parts, like a tree, and assign probabilities to each sub-branch of the tree, to get a total probability of the question being true.
                Here is the question:
                Israel x Hamas ceasefire by August 15?
                More details:
                On March 17, Israel announced extensive strikes on terror targets belonging to the Hamas terrorist organization in the Gaza Strip ending a previous ceasefire agreement which had been agreed on January 15 (See: https://x.com/IDF/status/1901802698237935705).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if there is an official ceasefire agreement, defined as a publicly announced and mutually agreed halt in military engagement, between Israel and Hamas between July 14, and August 15, 2025, 11:59 PM ET.

If the agreement is officially reached before the resolution date, this market will resolve to "Yes", regardless of whether the ceasefire officially starts afterwards.

An announced agreement to reinstate the previous agreed upon January 15th ceasefire deal will qualify.

Any form of informal agreement will not be considered an official ceasefire. Humanitarian pauses will not count toward the resolution of this market.

This market's resolution will be based on official announcements from both Israel and Hamas, however a wide consensus of credible media reporting stating an official ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas has been reached will suffice.


                Here are the latest rates for the 'yes' to that question (rates for 'yes' and 'no' sum to 1), to guide you:
                2025-07-18    0.670
2025-07-19    0.675
2025-07-20    0.665
2025-07-21    0.635
2025-07-22    0.570
2025-07-23    0.645
2025-07-24    0.595
2025-07-25    0.340
2025-07-26    0.255
2025-07-27    0.230
2025-07-28    0.295
2025-07-29    0.265
2025-07-30    0.175
2025-07-31    0.195
2025-08-01    0.195

                Invest in yes only if you think the yes is underrated, and invest in no only if you think that the yes is overrated.
                What would you decide: buy yes, buy no, or do nothing?

Israel/Palestinian Territories – Ceasefire and hostage release agreement in Gaza (15 January 2025)
==================================================================================================

Share

* [Share on Twitter](https://twitter.com/share?text=Israel/Palestinian%20Territories%20%E2%80%93%20Ceasefire%20and%20hostage%20release%20agreement%20in%20Gaza%20(15%20Jan.%202025)&url=https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/country-files/israel-palestinian-territories/news/2025/article/israel-palestinian-territories-ceasefire-and-hostage-release-agreement-in-gaza "Share on Twitter (external link)")
* [Share on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dialog/feed?app_id=123141381158052&link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.diplomatie.gouv.fr%2Fen%2Fcountry-files%2Fisrael-palestinian-territories%2Fnews%2F2025%2Farticle%2Fisrael-palestinian-territories-ceasefire-and-hostage-release-agreement-in-gaza&picture=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.diplomatie.gouv.fr%2Fplugins%2Ffdiplo_themes%2Fimages%2FFB_FD_defaut_article.jpg&name=Israel%2FPalestinian%20Territories%20%E2%80%93%20Ceasefire%20and%20hostage%20release%20agreement%20in%20Gaza%20%2815%20Jan.%202025%29&description=%20%0A%0AFrance%20welcomes%20the%20conclusion%20of%20a%20ceasefire%20and%20hostage%20release%20agreement%20for%20Gaza.%20It%20thanks%20the%20mediators%2C%20particularly%20the%20United%20States%2C%20%28%26hellip%3B%29%20&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.diplomatie.gouv.fr%2Fen%2Fcountry-files%2Fisrael-palestinian-territories%2Fnews%2F2025%2Farticle%2Fisrael-palestinian-territories-ceasefire-and-hostage-release-agreement-in-gaza "Share on Facebook (external link)")
* [Partager sur Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.diplomatie.gouv.fr%2Fen%2Fcountry-files%2Fisrael-palestinian-territories%2Fnews%2F2025%2Farticle%2Fisrael-palestinian-territories-ceasefire-and-hostage-release-agreement-in-gaza&title=Israel%2FPalestinian%20Territories%20%E2%80%93%20Ceasefire%20and%20hostage%20release%20agreement%20in%20Gaza%20%2815%20Jan.%202025%29&summary=%20%0A%0AFrance%20welcomes%20the%20conclusion%20of%20a%20ceasefire%20and%20hostage%20release%20agreement%20for%20Gaza.%20It%20thanks%20the%20mediators%2C%20particularly%20the%20United%20States%2C%20%28%26hellip%3B%29%20&source=Ministry%20for%20Europe%20and%20Foreign%20Affairs "Partager sur Linkedin (external link)")
* Print

France welcomes the conclusion of a ceasefire and hostage release agreement for Gaza. It thanks the mediators, particularly the United States, Qatar and Egypt, for their efforts that made this agreement possible, and calls on the parties to implement it immediately.

For more than a year, France has been calling for a lasting ceasefire in Gaza, the unconditional release of hostages and the massive and unhindered delivery of humanitarian aid to the enclave, in order to end the intolerable suffering of civilians and work on a political solution.

This agreement should enable the release of all hostages still in captivity in Gaza, including two French nationals, Ofer Kalderon and Ohad Yahalomi. France fought untiringly for their release, from the very first days to these last hours. We are totally committed to ensuring they can be reunited with their loved ones.

Today, more than a year after the 7 October massacres committed in Israel by Hamas, which cost the lives of almost 1,200 people, including 49 French nationals, and after 15 months of war that followed and that has subjected Gaza’s people to extreme suffering and destroyed almost all vital infrastructure, the ceasefire must absolutely be implemented and sustained. The absolute humanitarian emergency in Gaza must be addressed, and reconstruction work must begin immediately.

France calls for all Gaza access points to be opened immediately and for the work of international organizations and humanitarian agencies to be facilitated by Israel, in accordance with international law and the rulings of the International Court of Justice. Life must once again prevail in Gaza.

The Palestinian Authority should administrate this Palestinian territory, and its return must be prepared.

France calls for the friends of Israel and Palestine to seize the opportunity offered by this ceasefire to trigger an irreversible process for the effective implementation of the two-state solution, with security guarantees for both the Israelis and the Palestinians, which is the only avenue to ensure a just and lasting peace.

France is committed to this, alongside its partners, within the United Nations Security Council and all international forums. In June 2025, it will co-chair, alongside Saudi Arabia, an international conference on the implementation of the two-state solution. France calls on the Israelis and Palestinians to take the only path that will guarantee them a future of peace and security.
